title: 'Good Monitor
body: '1.0 out of 5 stars''I purchased the BenQ GW2480-T monitor a while back and initially was pleased with its performance. The display quality was up to the mark and it fit well with my work and entertainment needs.  However after a while I began to experience an image retention or "ghosting" issue. This phenomenon although common with LCDs if static images are left on for an extended period became a significant concern for me especially as my monitor was still under warranty.  My journey with BenQ\'s customer service however has been far from satisfactory. On multiple occasions I\'ve been given the same set of generic instructions to resolve the issue even after I clearly communicated that I had followed all their suggestions to no avail. The repeated copy-paste responses without any genuine attempt to address my concerns felt disheartening. I was hoping for a more personalized and attentive service considering the reputation BenQ holds in the market.  Moreover in one of my interactions I was informed over a call that they would look into my issue. Yet I\'ve received no update or follow-up on this.  To future buyers: The monitor itself has commendable features and its performance (barring the issue I faced) is noteworthy. However if you\'re someone who values post-purchase customer service as much as the product quality itself you might want to consider my experience before making a decision.  I genuinely hope BenQ takes this feedback positively and works on improving its customer service quality ensuring other customers don\'t have to face similar issues.'

title: 'Good while it works but you are out of luck if you need cto contact customer support.'
body: 'Worked fine for a couple of years and no complaints about that.  But when it failed (still in warranty) then the hellish experience started with customer support. The only good part was that an RMA# was issued on the same day of complaint.  But after that had no proper communication from their service staff (outsourced to some company called F1 InfoTech). Technician calls when he pleases with deadlines of an hour or less before showing up; if you are available great but if not keep your fingers crossed praying he will call you again.  Took them a week to find a spare part in their warehouse in the same city. And then waited a whole day for a no-show. Took another 3 days and had to call and press the technician to commit to a date for repair. And lo and behold the spare part was faulty.  Since that two promised deadlines from the F1 InfoTech people have passed and no new spare part yet. BenQ staff are silent spectators on an email thread; maybe they are enjoying watching their customers suffer.  Good monitor while it lasts but cannot recommend to anyone after the terrible customer support experience.'
